title: Add error handling for network and parse failures

task.title: Add error handling for network and parse failures
task.description:
## Context
Add robust error handling for network failures, parse errors, and other exceptional conditions throughout Toolsmith.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 1.5h
**Approach:** Define custom exceptions, add try/except blocks, provide user-friendly error messages.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/exceptions.py`
2. Define custom exceptions: `ToolsmithError`, `SourceError`, `ParseError`, `NetworkError`
3. Update source adapters to catch and wrap errors
4. Update service to handle source errors gracefully
5. Update CLI to display user-friendly error messages
6. Add `--debug` flag to show full tracebacks

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Custom exception hierarchy defined
- [ ] Network errors are caught and wrapped with context
- [ ] Parse errors include source name and what failed
- [ ] Service continues with other sources on single source failure
- [ ] CLI displays user-friendly error messages
- [ ] `--debug` flag shows full traceback
- [ ] No unhandled exceptions reach the user
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/exceptions.py` (new)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/*.py` (modify all)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/service.py` (modify)
- `src/cub/cli/toolsmith.py` (modify)

## Notes
- Wrap httpx exceptions in NetworkError
- Include original exception as `__cause__`
- Log errors at appropriate levels
- Consider partial success reporting in SyncResult
